remarks.format:
## Remarks The event occurs whenever the user clicks on a button on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar> control. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButtonClickEventArgs.Button%2A> property contains the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> wiith the information about the button that was clicked.
## Examples The following example instantiates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar> and three <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> controls. The toolbar buttons are assigned to the button collection, the collection is assigned to the toolbar, and the toolbar is added to the form. On the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ButtonClick> event of the toolbar, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButtonClickEventArgs.Button%2A> property of the ToolBarButtonClickEventArgs is evaluated, and the appropriate dialog opened. This code assumes that a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>, an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OpenFileDialog>, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SaveFileDialog>, and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog> have been instantiated.
